availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Carr Payne in Woodford County, Kentucky, on January 31, 1840. Father of Charles Payne, Virginia Payne, Nancy Payne, Theodosia Payne, Patrick Payne, Lemina Payne, and Bryan Payne. Farmer in Scott County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Farmer in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860. Farmer in Bainbridge, Dubois County, Indiana, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 449B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, p. 4.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 435A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Dubois County, IN, June 1863, p. 232.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film 000252328.
"William Payne (1817-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial 47618102, accessed May 31, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47618102.
